entries.title: Meta will reinstate Donald Trump's Facebook and Instagram accountants
entries.description: The former US president had his accounts suspended on January 7, 2021 a day after the deadly insurrection on the US capitol.

entries.title: Machete attack in Spanish church leaves one dead
entries.description: Spain’s National Court said a judge has opened an investigation into a possible act of terrorism.

entries.title: Tesla reports record profit and confirms its long-term growth plan
entries.description: Despite concerns about rising competition and macroeconomic headwinds, Elon Musk's electric vehicle company reported fourth-quarter profits up 59 percent from the year-ago period.

entries.title: Bomb kills 27 herders in central Nigeria
entries.description: Experts were investigating the origin of the explosion in a region known for ethnic and religious tensions.

entries.title: Russia shuts down oldest human rights group
entries.description: The decision is the latest in a series of legal rulings against organizations critical of the Kremlin.

entries.title: Morocco extradites French cybercrime suspect to US
entries.description: Sebastien Raoult, a French national suspected by the FBI of "conspiracy to commit electronic fraud and abuse" among other felonies was put on a flight to New York on Wednesday.

entries.title: UNESCO adds Odesa to list of endangered World Heritage sites
entries.description: The port city has been subjected to artillery attacks and air strikes by Russian forces on multiple occasions since the beginning of the war.

entries.title: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan withstands calls for boycott from Hindu extremists
entries.description: After a four-year absence, the movie star was back on screens on Wednesday with 'Pathaan.'

entries.title: Covid-19 in China: In Shanghai, corpses pile up in a cold storage unit
entries.description: 'Le Monde' was able to confirm the use of at least one cold storage facility in Shanghai, to handle a flow of bodies that exceeded the capacity of morgues and crematoria.

entries.title: Netanyahu seeks to reassure Jordan about far-right allies
entries.description: During a visit to Amman, the Israeli prime minister sought to ease tensions caused by the visit of a radical minister to the al-Aqsa compound in Jerusalem which is administered by Jordan since 1967.

entries.title: Lebanon: Judge orders release of Beirut port blast detainees
entries.description: All suspects detained in the deadly 2020 port blast in Beirut were to be released on Wednesday following the resumption of the investigation which had been stalling for months.

entries.title: French troops to exit Burkina Faso within a month
entries.description: Around 400 French special forces are currently based in Burkina Faso as part of a broader military presence to fight jihadists across the Sahel region.

entries.title: How Brussels made EU recovery funds conditional on concrete targets
entries.description: The 27 member states of the European Union have committed to reaching more than 5,000 'targets and milestones' in order to receive European funds. Recovery Files, a pan-European organization, investigated their content.

entries.title: France considers sending Leclerc tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: No decision to provide French tanks has been taken yet, Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne told lawmakers on Wednesday, following Germany's decision to authorize deliveries of Leopard 2 battle tanks to Kyiv.

entries.title: French government moves forward with energy bills in Parliament
entries.description: The Sénat greenlighted the government's legislation to accelerate the development of nuclear energy, while a joint committee between both houses of Parliament agreed on a compromise on a similar bill on renewable energy.

entries.title: At trial over plot to kill Macron, far-right schemers evade questions
entries.description: Thirteen of the members of the ultraright group the Barjols have been on trial since January 17 in the Paris criminal court for "terrorist criminal association."

entries.title: Washington to pay Lebanese army and police salaries for six months
entries.description: As Lebanon's economy remains in limbo, payments will provide every soldier and police officer eligible to receive assistance under US law with $100 per month.

entries.title: Amazon employees hold first UK strike over pay and work conditions
entries.description: Amazon staff are the latest group of British workers to join the picket lines as high food and energy prices drive the highest inflation in decades.

entries.title: Ukraine's Zelensky puts fight against corruption in limelight to reassure West
entries.description: Four deputy ministers and five regional governors have been sacked or forced to resign following scandals linked to financial misappropriation. It's a show of force from Kyiv before an EU-Ukraine summit on February 3.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Germany and US expected to reveal tank deliveries
entries.description: Germany’s decision to send their Leopard tanks is expected to be made official on Wednesday as the US appears poised to start sending dozens of M1 Abrams tanks.

entries.title: Lebanese MPs occupy parliament demanding the election of a president
entries.description: 'The people are suffering and no one is doing anything,' said Najat Saliba and Melhem Khalaf, who are calling for an end to the political stalemate since General Michel Aoun left office four months ago.

entries.title: Macron and the youth: What happened to the start-up nation?
entries.description: The 45-year-old French president is accused of favoring senior citizens, who now represent the biggest part of the electorate.

entries.title: Hundreds of dead dolphins wash up along the French Atlantic Coast
entries.description: Between Christmas 2022 and January 15, nearly 300 dead dolphins, accidentally caught in fishing nets, were discovered. Some of the animals had been mutilated and gutted.

entries.title: Australian Open: Magda Linette upsets Karolina Pliskova to reach semi-final
entries.description: Linette continued flying the flag for Poland after stunning former world number one Pliskova 6-3, 7-5 to reach her first ever Grand Slam semi-final.

entries.title: Classified documents found at the home of former United States Vice President Mike Pence
entries.description: After the scandals involving Donald Trump and Joe Biden, this new incident raises further questions about the US government’s widespread negligence.

entries.title: Accused of not sufficiently protecting biodiversity, France takes refuge behind European law
entries.description: The groups behind the legal action accuse France of failing in the process of authorizing pesticides, which have a major impact on the destruction of species and ecosystems.

entries.title: Qatar suspected of targetting critics of World Cup in global hacking operation
entries.description: According to information provided by 'Le Monde', three preliminary investigations have been opened at the Paris prosecutor's office.

entries.title: Justin Bieber sells his music catalog for $200 million
entries.description: Blackstone-backed Hipgnosis Songs Capital has acquired Bieber's publishing copyrights to his 290-song back catalog.
